26#include <sys/cdefs.h>
27__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_uncore.c,v 1.10 2018/08/27 15:09:35 riastradh Exp $");

29#include "i915_drv.h"
30#include "intel_drv.h"
31#include "i915_vgpu.h"
32#include "i915_trace.h"
33
34#include <linux/err.h>
35#include <linux/pm_runtime.h>
36
37#define FORCEWAKE_ACK_TIMEOUT_MS 50
38
39#ifdef __NetBSD__
40
41#define __raw_i915_read8(dev_priv, reg) bus_space_read_1((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg))
42#define __raw_i915_write8(dev_priv, reg, val) bus_space_write_1((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg), (val))
43
44#define __raw_i915_read16(dev_priv, reg) bus_space_read_2((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg))
45#define __raw_i915_write16(dev_priv, reg, val) bus_space_write_2((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg), (val))
46
47#define __raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, reg) bus_space_read_4((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg))
48#define __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, reg, val) bus_space_write_4((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg), (val))
49
50#ifdef _LP64
51#define __raw_i915_read64(dev_priv, reg) bus_space_read_8((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg))
52#define __raw_i915_write64(dev_priv, reg, val) bus_space_write_8((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg), (val))
53#else
54#define __raw_i915_read64(dev_priv, reg) (bus_space_read_4((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg)) | ((uint64_t)bus_space_read_4((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg) + 4) << 32))
55#define __raw_i915_write64(dev_priv, reg, val) (bus_space_write_4((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg), (uint32_t)(val)), bus_space_write_4((dev_priv)->regs_bst, (dev_priv)->regs_bsh, (reg) + 4, (uint32_t)((val) >> 32)))
56#endif
57
58#else
59
60#define __raw_i915_read8(dev_priv__, reg__) readb((dev_priv__)->regs + (reg__))
61#define __raw_i915_write8(dev_priv__, reg__, val__) writeb(val__, (dev_priv__)->regs + (reg__))
62
63#define __raw_i915_read16(dev_priv__, reg__) readw((dev_priv__)->regs + (reg__))
64#define __raw_i915_write16(dev_priv__, reg__, val__) writew(val__, (dev_priv__)->regs + (reg__))
65
66#define __raw_i915_read32(dev_priv__, reg__) readl((dev_priv__)->regs + (reg__))
67#define __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv__, reg__, val__) writel(val__, (dev_priv__)->regs + (reg__))
68
69#define __raw_i915_read64(dev_priv__, reg__) readq((dev_priv__)->regs + (reg__))
70#define __raw_i915_write64(dev_priv__, reg__, val__) writeq(val__, (dev_priv__)->regs + (reg__))
71
72#endif
73
74#define __raw_posting_read(dev_priv__, reg__) (void)__raw_i915_read32(dev_priv__, reg__)
75
76static const char * const forcewake_domain_names[] = {
77 "render",
78 "blitter",
79 "media",
80};
81
82const char *
83intel_uncore_forcewake_domain_to_str(const enum forcewake_domain_id id)
84{
85 BUILD_BUG_ON(ARRAY_SIZE(forcewake_domain_names) != FW_DOMAIN_ID_COUNT);
86
87 if (id >= 0 && id < FW_DOMAIN_ID_COUNT)
88 return forcewake_domain_names[id];
89
90 WARN_ON(id);
91
92 return "unknown";
93}
94
95static void
96assert_device_not_suspended(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
97{
98 WARN_ONCE(HAS_RUNTIME_PM(dev_priv->dev) && dev_priv->pm.suspended,
99 "Device suspended\n");
100}
101
102static inline void
103fw_domain_reset(const struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d)
104{
105 WARN_ON(d->reg_set == 0);
106 __raw_i915_write32(d->i915, d->reg_set, d->val_reset);
107}
108
109static inline void
110fw_domain_arm_timer(struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d)
111{
112 mod_timer_pinned(&d->timer, jiffies + 1);
113}
114
115static inline void
116fw_domain_wait_ack_clear(const struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d)
117{
118 if (wait_for_atomic((__raw_i915_read32(d->i915, d->reg_ack) &
119 FORCEWAKE_KERNEL) == 0,
120 FORCEWAKE_ACK_TIMEOUT_MS))
121 DRM_ERROR("%s: timed out waiting for forcewake ack to clear.\n",
122 intel_uncore_forcewake_domain_to_str(d->id));
123}
124
125static inline void
126fw_domain_get(const struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d)
127{
128 __raw_i915_write32(d->i915, d->reg_set, d->val_set);
129}
130
131static inline void
132fw_domain_wait_ack(const struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d)
133{
134 if (wait_for_atomic((__raw_i915_read32(d->i915, d->reg_ack) &
135 FORCEWAKE_KERNEL),
136 FORCEWAKE_ACK_TIMEOUT_MS))
137 DRM_ERROR("%s: timed out waiting for forcewake ack request.\n",
138 intel_uncore_forcewake_domain_to_str(d->id));
139}
140
141static inline void
142fw_domain_put(const struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d)
143{
144 __raw_i915_write32(d->i915, d->reg_set, d->val_clear);
145}
146
147static inline void
148fw_domain_posting_read(const struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d)
149{
150 /* something from same cacheline, but not from the set register */
151 if (d->reg_post)
152 __raw_posting_read(d->i915, d->reg_post);
153}
154
155static void
156fw_domains_get(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
157{
158 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d;
159 enum forcewake_domain_id id;
160
161 for_each_fw_domain_mask(d, fw_domains, dev_priv, id) {
162 fw_domain_wait_ack_clear(d);
163 fw_domain_get(d);
164 fw_domain_wait_ack(d);
165 }
166}
167
168static void
169fw_domains_put(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
170{
171 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d;
172 enum forcewake_domain_id id;
173
174 for_each_fw_domain_mask(d, fw_domains, dev_priv, id) {
175 fw_domain_put(d);
176 fw_domain_posting_read(d);
177 }
178}
179
180static void
181fw_domains_posting_read(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
182{
183 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d;
184 enum forcewake_domain_id id;
185
186 /* No need to do for all, just do for first found */
187 for_each_fw_domain(d, dev_priv, id) {
188 fw_domain_posting_read(d);
189 break;
190 }
191}
192
193static void
194fw_domains_reset(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
195{
196 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d;
197 enum forcewake_domain_id id;
198
199 if (dev_priv->uncore.fw_domains == 0)
200 return;
201
202 for_each_fw_domain_mask(d, fw_domains, dev_priv, id)
203 fw_domain_reset(d);
204
205 fw_domains_posting_read(dev_priv);
206}
207
208static void __gen6_gt_wait_for_thread_c0(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
209{
210 /* w/a for a sporadic read returning 0 by waiting for the GT
211 * thread to wake up.
212 */
213 if (wait_for_atomic_us((__raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, GEN6_GT_THREAD_STATUS_REG) &
214 GEN6_GT_THREAD_STATUS_CORE_MASK) == 0, 500))
215 DRM_ERROR("GT thread status wait timed out\n");
216}
217
218static void fw_domains_get_with_thread_status(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
219 enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
220{
221 fw_domains_get(dev_priv, fw_domains);
222
223 /* WaRsForcewakeWaitTC0:snb,ivb,hsw,bdw,vlv */
224 __gen6_gt_wait_for_thread_c0(dev_priv);
225}
226
227static void gen6_gt_check_fifodbg(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
228{
229 u32 gtfifodbg;
230
231 gtfifodbg = __raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, GTFIFODBG);
232 if (WARN(gtfifodbg, "GT wake FIFO error 0x%x\n", gtfifodbg))
233 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, GTFIFODBG, gtfifodbg);
234}
235
236static void fw_domains_put_with_fifo(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
237 enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
238{
239 fw_domains_put(dev_priv, fw_domains);
240 gen6_gt_check_fifodbg(dev_priv);
241}
242
243static inline u32 fifo_free_entries(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
244{
245 u32 count = __raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, GTFIFOCTL);
246
247 return count & GT_FIFO_FREE_ENTRIES_MASK;
248}
249
250static int __gen6_gt_wait_for_fifo(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
251{
252 int ret = 0;
253
254 /* On VLV, FIFO will be shared by both SW and HW.
255 * So, we need to read the FREE_ENTRIES everytime */
256 if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev_priv->dev))
257 dev_priv->uncore.fifo_count = fifo_free_entries(dev_priv);
258
259 if (dev_priv->uncore.fifo_count < GT_FIFO_NUM_RESERVED_ENTRIES) {
260 int loop = 500;
261 u32 fifo = fifo_free_entries(dev_priv);
262
263 while (fifo <= GT_FIFO_NUM_RESERVED_ENTRIES && loop--) {
264 udelay(10);
265 fifo = fifo_free_entries(dev_priv);
266 }
267 if (WARN_ON(loop < 0 && fifo <= GT_FIFO_NUM_RESERVED_ENTRIES))
268 ++ret;
269 dev_priv->uncore.fifo_count = fifo;
270 }
271 dev_priv->uncore.fifo_count--;
272
273 return ret;
274}
275
276static void intel_uncore_fw_release_timer(unsigned long arg)
277{
278 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *domain = (void *)arg;
279 unsigned long irqflags;
280
281 assert_device_not_suspended(domain->i915);
282
283 spin_lock_irqsave(&domain->i915->uncore.lock, irqflags);
284 if (WARN_ON(domain->wake_count == 0))
285 domain->wake_count++;
286
287 if (--domain->wake_count == 0)
288 domain->i915->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put(domain->i915,
289 1 << domain->id);
290
291 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&domain->i915->uncore.lock, irqflags);
292}
293
294void intel_uncore_forcewake_reset(struct drm_device *dev, bool restore)
295{
296 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
297 unsigned long irqflags;
298 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *domain;
299 int retry_count = 100;
300 enum forcewake_domain_id id;
301 enum forcewake_domains fw = 0, active_domains;
302
303 /* Hold uncore.lock across reset to prevent any register access
304 * with forcewake not set correctly. Wait until all pending
305 * timers are run before holding.
306 */
307 while (1) {
308 active_domains = 0;
309
310 for_each_fw_domain(domain, dev_priv, id) {
311 if (del_timer_sync(&domain->timer) == 0)
312 continue;
313
314 intel_uncore_fw_release_timer((unsigned long)domain);
315 }
316
317 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags);
318
319 for_each_fw_domain(domain, dev_priv, id) {
320 if (timer_pending(&domain->timer))
321 active_domains |= (1 << id);
322 }
323
324 if (active_domains == 0)
325 break;
326
327 if (--retry_count == 0) {
328 DRM_ERROR("Timed out waiting for forcewake timers to finish\n");
329 break;
330 }
331
332 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags);
333 cond_resched();
334 }
335
336 WARN_ON(active_domains);
337
338 for_each_fw_domain(domain, dev_priv, id)
339 if (domain->wake_count)
340 fw |= 1 << id;
341
342 if (fw)
343 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put(dev_priv, fw);
344
345 fw_domains_reset(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
346
347 if (restore) { /* If reset with a user forcewake, try to restore */
348 if (fw)
349 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get(dev_priv, fw);
350
351 if (IS_GEN6(dev) || IS_GEN7(dev))
352 dev_priv->uncore.fifo_count =
353 fifo_free_entries(dev_priv);
354 }
355
356 if (!restore)
357 assert_forcewakes_inactive(dev_priv);
358
359 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags);
360}
361
362static void intel_uncore_ellc_detect(struct drm_device *dev)
363{
364 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
365
366 if ((IS_HASWELL(dev) || IS_BROADWELL(dev) ||
367 INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9) &&
368 (__raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, HSW_EDRAM_PRESENT) & EDRAM_ENABLED)) {
369 /* The docs do not explain exactly how the calculation can be
370 * made. It is somewhat guessable, but for now, it's always
371 * 128MB.
372 * NB: We can't write IDICR yet because we do not have gt funcs
373 * set up */
374 dev_priv->ellc_size = 128;
375 DRM_INFO("Found %zuMB of eLLC\n", dev_priv->ellc_size);
376 }
377}
378
379static void __intel_uncore_early_sanitize(struct drm_device *dev,
380 bool restore_forcewake)
381{
382 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
383
384 if (HAS_FPGA_DBG_UNCLAIMED(dev))
385 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, FPGA_DBG, FPGA_DBG_RM_NOCLAIM);
386
387 /* clear out old GT FIFO errors */
388 if (IS_GEN6(dev) || IS_GEN7(dev))
389 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, GTFIFODBG,
390 __raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, GTFIFODBG));
391
392 /* WaDisableShadowRegForCpd:chv */
393 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev)) {
394 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, GTFIFOCTL,
395 __raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, GTFIFOCTL) |
396 GT_FIFO_CTL_BLOCK_ALL_POLICY_STALL |
397 GT_FIFO_CTL_RC6_POLICY_STALL);
398 }
399
400 intel_uncore_forcewake_reset(dev, restore_forcewake);
401}
402
403void intel_uncore_early_sanitize(struct drm_device *dev, bool restore_forcewake)
404{
405 __intel_uncore_early_sanitize(dev, restore_forcewake);
406 i915_check_and_clear_faults(dev);
407}
408
409void intel_uncore_sanitize(struct drm_device *dev)
410{
411 /* BIOS often leaves RC6 enabled, but disable it for hw init */
412 intel_disable_gt_powersave(dev);
413}
414
415static void __intel_uncore_forcewake_get(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
416 enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
417{
418 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *domain;
419 enum forcewake_domain_id id;
420
421 if (!dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get)
422 return;
423
424 fw_domains &= dev_priv->uncore.fw_domains;
425
426 for_each_fw_domain_mask(domain, fw_domains, dev_priv, id) {
427 if (domain->wake_count++)
428 fw_domains &= ~(1 << id);
429 }
430
431 if (fw_domains)
432 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get(dev_priv, fw_domains);
433}
434
435/**
436 * intel_uncore_forcewake_get - grab forcewake domain references
437 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
438 * @fw_domains: forcewake domains to get reference on
439 *
440 * This function can be used get GT's forcewake domain references.
441 * Normal register access will handle the forcewake domains automatically.
442 * However if some sequence requires the GT to not power down a particular
443 * forcewake domains this function should be called at the beginning of the
444 * sequence. And subsequently the reference should be dropped by symmetric
445 * call to intel_unforce_forcewake_put(). Usually caller wants all the domains
446 * to be kept awake so the @fw_domains would be then FORCEWAKE_ALL.
447 */
448void intel_uncore_forcewake_get(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
449 enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
450{
451 unsigned long irqflags;
452
453 if (!dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get)
454 return;
455
456 WARN_ON(dev_priv->pm.suspended);
457
458 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags);
459 __intel_uncore_forcewake_get(dev_priv, fw_domains);
460 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags);
461}
462
463/**
464 * intel_uncore_forcewake_get__locked - grab forcewake domain references
465 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
466 * @fw_domains: forcewake domains to get reference on
467 *
468 * See intel_uncore_forcewake_get(). This variant places the onus
469 * on the caller to explicitly handle the dev_priv->uncore.lock spinlock.
470 */
471void intel_uncore_forcewake_get__locked(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
472 enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
473{
474 assert_spin_locked(&dev_priv->uncore.lock);
475
476 if (!dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get)
477 return;
478
479 __intel_uncore_forcewake_get(dev_priv, fw_domains);
480}
481
482static void __intel_uncore_forcewake_put(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
483 enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
484{
485 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *domain;
486 enum forcewake_domain_id id;
487
488 if (!dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put)
489 return;
490
491 fw_domains &= dev_priv->uncore.fw_domains;
492
493 for_each_fw_domain_mask(domain, fw_domains, dev_priv, id) {
494 if (WARN_ON(domain->wake_count == 0))
495 continue;
496
497 if (--domain->wake_count)
498 continue;
499
500 domain->wake_count++;
501 fw_domain_arm_timer(domain);
502 }
503}
504
505/**
506 * intel_uncore_forcewake_put - release a forcewake domain reference
507 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
508 * @fw_domains: forcewake domains to put references
509 *
510 * This function drops the device-level forcewakes for specified
511 * domains obtained by intel_uncore_forcewake_get().
512 */
513void intel_uncore_forcewake_put(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
514 enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
515{
516 unsigned long irqflags;
517
518 if (!dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put)
519 return;
520
521 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags);
522 __intel_uncore_forcewake_put(dev_priv, fw_domains);
523 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags);
524}
525
526/**
527 * intel_uncore_forcewake_put__locked - grab forcewake domain references
528 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
529 * @fw_domains: forcewake domains to get reference on
530 *
531 * See intel_uncore_forcewake_put(). This variant places the onus
532 * on the caller to explicitly handle the dev_priv->uncore.lock spinlock.
533 */
534void intel_uncore_forcewake_put__locked(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
535 enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
536{
537 assert_spin_locked(&dev_priv->uncore.lock);
538
539 if (!dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put)
540 return;
541
542 __intel_uncore_forcewake_put(dev_priv, fw_domains);
543}
544
545void assert_forcewakes_inactive(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
546{
547 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *domain;
548 enum forcewake_domain_id id;
549
550 if (!dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get)
551 return;
552
553 for_each_fw_domain(domain, dev_priv, id)
554 WARN_ON(domain->wake_count);
555}
556
557/* We give fast paths for the really cool registers */
558#define NEEDS_FORCE_WAKE(reg) \
559 ((reg) < 0x40000 && (reg) != FORCEWAKE)
560
561#define REG_RANGE(reg, start, end) ((reg) >= (start) && (reg) < (end))
562
563#define FORCEWAKE_VLV_RENDER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
564 (REG_RANGE((reg), 0x2000, 0x4000) || \
565 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x5000, 0x8000) || \
566 REG_RANGE((reg), 0xB000, 0x12000) || \
567 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x2E000, 0x30000))
568
569#define FORCEWAKE_VLV_MEDIA_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
570 (REG_RANGE((reg), 0x12000, 0x14000) || \
571 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x22000, 0x24000) || \
572 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x30000, 0x40000))
573
574#define FORCEWAKE_CHV_RENDER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
575 (REG_RANGE((reg), 0x2000, 0x4000) || \
576 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x5200, 0x8000) || \
577 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x8300, 0x8500) || \
578 REG_RANGE((reg), 0xB000, 0xB480) || \
579 REG_RANGE((reg), 0xE000, 0xE800))
580
581#define FORCEWAKE_CHV_MEDIA_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
582 (REG_RANGE((reg), 0x8800, 0x8900) || \
583 REG_RANGE((reg), 0xD000, 0xD800) || \
584 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x12000, 0x14000) || \
585 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x1A000, 0x1C000) || \
586 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x1E800, 0x1EA00) || \
587 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x30000, 0x38000))
588
589#define FORCEWAKE_CHV_COMMON_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
590 (REG_RANGE((reg), 0x4000, 0x5000) || \
591 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x8000, 0x8300) || \
592 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x8500, 0x8600) || \
593 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x9000, 0xB000) || \
594 REG_RANGE((reg), 0xF000, 0x10000))
595
596#define FORCEWAKE_GEN9_UNCORE_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
597 REG_RANGE((reg), 0xB00, 0x2000)
598
599#define FORCEWAKE_GEN9_RENDER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
600 (REG_RANGE((reg), 0x2000, 0x2700) || \
601 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x3000, 0x4000) || \
602 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x5200, 0x8000) || \
603 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x8140, 0x8160) || \
604 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x8300, 0x8500) || \
605 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x8C00, 0x8D00) || \
606 REG_RANGE((reg), 0xB000, 0xB480) || \
607 REG_RANGE((reg), 0xE000, 0xE900) || \
608 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x24400, 0x24800))
609
610#define FORCEWAKE_GEN9_MEDIA_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
611 (REG_RANGE((reg), 0x8130, 0x8140) || \
612 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x8800, 0x8A00) || \
613 REG_RANGE((reg), 0xD000, 0xD800) || \
614 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x12000, 0x14000) || \
615 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x1A000, 0x1EA00) || \
616 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x30000, 0x40000))
617
618#define FORCEWAKE_GEN9_COMMON_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
619 REG_RANGE((reg), 0x9400, 0x9800)
620
621#define FORCEWAKE_GEN9_BLITTER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) \
622 ((reg) < 0x40000 &&\
623 !FORCEWAKE_GEN9_UNCORE_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) && \
624 !FORCEWAKE_GEN9_RENDER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) && \
625 !FORCEWAKE_GEN9_MEDIA_RANGE_OFFSET(reg) && \
626 !FORCEWAKE_GEN9_COMMON_RANGE_OFFSET(reg))
627
628static void
629ilk_dummy_write(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
630{
631 /* WaIssueDummyWriteToWakeupFromRC6:ilk Issue a dummy write to wake up
632 * the chip from rc6 before touching it for real. MI_MODE is masked,
633 * hence harmless to write 0 into. */
634 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, MI_MODE, 0);
635}
636
637static void
638hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, u32 reg, bool read,
639 bool before)
640{
641 const char *op = read ? "reading" : "writing to";
642 const char *when = before ? "before" : "after";
643
644 if (!i915.mmio_debug)
645 return;
646
647 if (__raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, FPGA_DBG) & FPGA_DBG_RM_NOCLAIM) {
648 WARN(1, "Unclaimed register detected %s %s register 0x%x\n",
649 when, op, reg);
650 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, FPGA_DBG, FPGA_DBG_RM_NOCLAIM);
651 i915.mmio_debug--; /* Only report the first N failures */
652 }
653}
654
655static void
656hsw_unclaimed_reg_detect(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
657{
658 static bool mmio_debug_once = true;
659
660 if (i915.mmio_debug || !mmio_debug_once)
661 return;
662
663 if (__raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, FPGA_DBG) & FPGA_DBG_RM_NOCLAIM) {
664 DRM_DEBUG("Unclaimed register detected, "
665 "enabling oneshot unclaimed register reporting. "
666 "Please use i915.mmio_debug=N for more information.\n");
667 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, FPGA_DBG, FPGA_DBG_RM_NOCLAIM);
668 i915.mmio_debug = mmio_debug_once;
669 mmio_debug_once = false;
670 }
671}
672
673#define GEN2_READ_HEADER(x) \
674 u##x val = 0; \
675 assert_device_not_suspended(dev_priv);
676
677#define GEN2_READ_FOOTER \
678 trace_i915_reg_rw(false, reg, val, sizeof(val), trace); \
679 return val
680
681#define __gen2_read(x) \
682static u##x \
683gen2_read##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, bool trace) { \
684 GEN2_READ_HEADER(x); \
685 val = __raw_i915_read##x(dev_priv, reg); \
686 GEN2_READ_FOOTER; \
687}
688
689#define __gen5_read(x) \
690static u##x \
691gen5_read##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, bool trace) { \
692 GEN2_READ_HEADER(x); \
693 ilk_dummy_write(dev_priv); \
694 val = __raw_i915_read##x(dev_priv, reg); \
695 GEN2_READ_FOOTER; \
696}

713#define GEN6_READ_HEADER(x) \
714 unsigned long irqflags; \
715 u##x val = 0; \
716 assert_device_not_suspended(dev_priv); \
717 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags)
718
719#define GEN6_READ_FOOTER \
720 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags); \
721 trace_i915_reg_rw(false, reg, val, sizeof(val), trace); \
722 return val
723
724static inline void __force_wake_get(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
725 enum forcewake_domains fw_domains)
726{
727 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *domain;
728 enum forcewake_domain_id id;
729
730 if (WARN_ON(!fw_domains))
731 return;
732
733 /* Ideally GCC would be constant-fold and eliminate this loop */
734 for_each_fw_domain_mask(domain, fw_domains, dev_priv, id) {
735 if (domain->wake_count) {
736 fw_domains &= ~(1 << id);
737 continue;
738 }
739
740 domain->wake_count++;
741 fw_domain_arm_timer(domain);
742 }
743
744 if (fw_domains)
745 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get(dev_priv, fw_domains);
746}
747
748#define __vgpu_read(x) \
749static u##x \
750vgpu_read##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, bool trace) { \
751 GEN6_READ_HEADER(x); \
752 val = __raw_i915_read##x(dev_priv, reg); \
753 GEN6_READ_FOOTER; \
754}
755
756#define __gen6_read(x) \
757static u##x \
758gen6_read##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, bool trace) { \
759 GEN6_READ_HEADER(x); \
760 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, true, true); \
761 if (NEEDS_FORCE_WAKE(reg)) \
762 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_RENDER); \
763 val = __raw_i915_read##x(dev_priv, reg); \
764 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, true, false); \
765 GEN6_READ_FOOTER; \
766}
767
768#define __vlv_read(x) \
769static u##x \
770vlv_read##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, bool trace) { \
771 GEN6_READ_HEADER(x); \
772 if (FORCEWAKE_VLV_RENDER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
773 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_RENDER); \
774 else if (FORCEWAKE_VLV_MEDIA_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
775 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_MEDIA); \
776 val = __raw_i915_read##x(dev_priv, reg); \
777 GEN6_READ_FOOTER; \
778}
779
780#define __chv_read(x) \
781static u##x \
782chv_read##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, bool trace) { \
783 GEN6_READ_HEADER(x); \
784 if (FORCEWAKE_CHV_RENDER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
785 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_RENDER); \
786 else if (FORCEWAKE_CHV_MEDIA_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
787 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_MEDIA); \
788 else if (FORCEWAKE_CHV_COMMON_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
789 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, \
790 FORCEWAKE_RENDER | FORCEWAKE_MEDIA); \
791 val = __raw_i915_read##x(dev_priv, reg); \
792 GEN6_READ_FOOTER; \
793}
794
795#define SKL_NEEDS_FORCE_WAKE(reg) \
796 ((reg) < 0x40000 && !FORCEWAKE_GEN9_UNCORE_RANGE_OFFSET(reg))
797
798#define __gen9_read(x) \
799static u##x \
800gen9_read##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, bool trace) { \
801 enum forcewake_domains fw_engine; \
802 GEN6_READ_HEADER(x); \
803 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, true, true); \
804 if (!SKL_NEEDS_FORCE_WAKE(reg)) \
805 fw_engine = 0; \
806 else if (FORCEWAKE_GEN9_RENDER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
807 fw_engine = FORCEWAKE_RENDER; \
808 else if (FORCEWAKE_GEN9_MEDIA_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
809 fw_engine = FORCEWAKE_MEDIA; \
810 else if (FORCEWAKE_GEN9_COMMON_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
811 fw_engine = FORCEWAKE_RENDER | FORCEWAKE_MEDIA; \
812 else \
813 fw_engine = FORCEWAKE_BLITTER; \
814 if (fw_engine) \
815 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, fw_engine); \
816 val = __raw_i915_read##x(dev_priv, reg); \
817 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, true, false); \
818 GEN6_READ_FOOTER; \
819}

888#define GEN6_WRITE_HEADER \
889 unsigned long irqflags; \
890 trace_i915_reg_rw(true, reg, val, sizeof(val), trace); \
891 assert_device_not_suspended(dev_priv); \
892 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags)
893
894#define GEN6_WRITE_FOOTER \
895 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->uncore.lock, irqflags)

897#define __gen6_write(x) \
898static void \
899gen6_write##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, u##x val, bool trace) { \
900 u32 __fifo_ret = 0; \
901 GEN6_WRITE_HEADER; \
902 if (NEEDS_FORCE_WAKE(reg)) { \
903 __fifo_ret = __gen6_gt_wait_for_fifo(dev_priv); \
904 } \
905 __raw_i915_write##x(dev_priv, reg, val); \
906 if (unlikely(__fifo_ret)) { \
907 gen6_gt_check_fifodbg(dev_priv); \
908 } \
909 GEN6_WRITE_FOOTER; \
910}
911
912#define __hsw_write(x) \
913static void \
914hsw_write##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, u##x val, bool trace) { \
915 u32 __fifo_ret = 0; \
916 GEN6_WRITE_HEADER; \
917 if (NEEDS_FORCE_WAKE(reg)) { \
918 __fifo_ret = __gen6_gt_wait_for_fifo(dev_priv); \
919 } \
920 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, false, true); \
921 __raw_i915_write##x(dev_priv, reg, val); \
922 if (unlikely(__fifo_ret)) { \
923 gen6_gt_check_fifodbg(dev_priv); \
924 } \
925 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, false, false); \
926 hsw_unclaimed_reg_detect(dev_priv); \
927 GEN6_WRITE_FOOTER; \
928}

932 off_t reg, u##x val, bool trace) { \
933 GEN6_WRITE_HEADER; \
934 __raw_i915_write##x(dev_priv, reg, val); \
935 GEN6_WRITE_FOOTER; \
936}

938static const u32 gen8_shadowed_regs[] = {
939 FORCEWAKE_MT,
940 GEN6_RPNSWREQ,
941 GEN6_RC_VIDEO_FREQ,
942 RING_TAIL(RENDER_RING_BASE),
943 RING_TAIL(GEN6_BSD_RING_BASE),
944 RING_TAIL(VEBOX_RING_BASE),
945 RING_TAIL(BLT_RING_BASE),
946 /* TODO: Other registers are not yet used */
947};
948
949static bool is_gen8_shadowed(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, u32 reg)
950{
951 int i;
952 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(gen8_shadowed_regs); i++)
953 if (reg == gen8_shadowed_regs[i])
954 return true;
955
956 return false;
957}
958
959#define __gen8_write(x) \
960static void \
961gen8_write##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, u##x val, bool trace) { \
962 GEN6_WRITE_HEADER; \
963 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, false, true); \
964 if (reg < 0x40000 && !is_gen8_shadowed(dev_priv, reg)) \
965 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_RENDER); \
966 __raw_i915_write##x(dev_priv, reg, val); \
967 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, false, false); \
968 hsw_unclaimed_reg_detect(dev_priv); \
969 GEN6_WRITE_FOOTER; \
970}
971
972#define __chv_write(x) \
973static void \
974chv_write##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, u##x val, bool trace) { \
975 bool shadowed = is_gen8_shadowed(dev_priv, reg); \
976 GEN6_WRITE_HEADER; \
977 if (!shadowed) { \
978 if (FORCEWAKE_CHV_RENDER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
979 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_RENDER); \
980 else if (FORCEWAKE_CHV_MEDIA_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
981 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_MEDIA); \
982 else if (FORCEWAKE_CHV_COMMON_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
983 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_RENDER | FORCEWAKE_MEDIA); \
984 } \
985 __raw_i915_write##x(dev_priv, reg, val); \
986 GEN6_WRITE_FOOTER; \
987}

989static const u32 gen9_shadowed_regs[] = {
990 RING_TAIL(RENDER_RING_BASE),
991 RING_TAIL(GEN6_BSD_RING_BASE),
992 RING_TAIL(VEBOX_RING_BASE),
993 RING_TAIL(BLT_RING_BASE),
994 FORCEWAKE_BLITTER_GEN9,
995 FORCEWAKE_RENDER_GEN9,
996 FORCEWAKE_MEDIA_GEN9,
997 GEN6_RPNSWREQ,
998 GEN6_RC_VIDEO_FREQ,
999 /* TODO: Other registers are not yet used */
1000};
1001
1002static bool is_gen9_shadowed(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, u32 reg)
1003{
1004 int i;
1005 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(gen9_shadowed_regs); i++)
1006 if (reg == gen9_shadowed_regs[i])
1007 return true;
1008
1009 return false;
1010}
1011
1012#define __gen9_write(x) \
1013static void \
1014gen9_write##x(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, off_t reg, u##x val, \
1015 bool trace) { \
1016 enum forcewake_domains fw_engine; \
1017 GEN6_WRITE_HEADER; \
1018 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, false, true); \
1019 if (!SKL_NEEDS_FORCE_WAKE(reg) || \
1020 is_gen9_shadowed(dev_priv, reg)) \
1021 fw_engine = 0; \
1022 else if (FORCEWAKE_GEN9_RENDER_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
1023 fw_engine = FORCEWAKE_RENDER; \
1024 else if (FORCEWAKE_GEN9_MEDIA_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
1025 fw_engine = FORCEWAKE_MEDIA; \
1026 else if (FORCEWAKE_GEN9_COMMON_RANGE_OFFSET(reg)) \
1027 fw_engine = FORCEWAKE_RENDER | FORCEWAKE_MEDIA; \
1028 else \
1029 fw_engine = FORCEWAKE_BLITTER; \
1030 if (fw_engine) \
1031 __force_wake_get(dev_priv, fw_engine); \
1032 __raw_i915_write##x(dev_priv, reg, val); \
1033 hsw_unclaimed_reg_debug(dev_priv, reg, false, false); \
1034 hsw_unclaimed_reg_detect(dev_priv); \
1035 GEN6_WRITE_FOOTER; \
1036}

1072#define ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS(x) \
1073do { \
1074 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.mmio_writeb = x##_write8; \
1075 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.mmio_writew = x##_write16; \
1076 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.mmio_writel = x##_write32; \
1077 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.mmio_writeq = x##_write64; \
1078} while (0)
1079
1080#define ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS(x) \
1081do { \
1082 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.mmio_readb = x##_read8; \
1083 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.mmio_readw = x##_read16; \
1084 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.mmio_readl = x##_read32; \
1085 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.mmio_readq = x##_read64; \
1086} while (0)
1087
1088
1089static void fw_domain_init(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
1090 enum forcewake_domain_id domain_id,
1091 u32 reg_set, u32 reg_ack)
1092{
1093 struct intel_uncore_forcewake_domain *d;
1094
1095 if (WARN_ON(domain_id >= FW_DOMAIN_ID_COUNT))
1096 return;
1097
1098 d = &dev_priv->uncore.fw_domain[domain_id];
1099
1100 WARN_ON(d->wake_count);
1101
1102 d->wake_count = 0;
1103 d->reg_set = reg_set;
1104 d->reg_ack = reg_ack;
1105
1106 if (IS_GEN6(dev_priv)) {
1107 d->val_reset = 0;
1108 d->val_set = FORCEWAKE_KERNEL;
1109 d->val_clear = 0;
1110 } else {
1111 /* WaRsClearFWBitsAtReset:bdw,skl */
1112 d->val_reset = _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(0xffff);
1113 d->val_set = _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(FORCEWAKE_KERNEL);
1114 d->val_clear = _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(FORCEWAKE_KERNEL);
1115 }
1116
1117 if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev_priv))
1118 d->reg_post = FORCEWAKE_ACK_VLV;
1119 else if (IS_GEN6(dev_priv) || IS_GEN7(dev_priv) || IS_GEN8(dev_priv))
1120 d->reg_post = ECOBUS;
1121 else
1122 d->reg_post = 0;
1123
1124 d->i915 = dev_priv;
1125 d->id = domain_id;
1126
1127 setup_timer(&d->timer, intel_uncore_fw_release_timer, (unsigned long)d);
1128
1129 dev_priv->uncore.fw_domains |= (1 << domain_id);
1130
1131 fw_domain_reset(d);
1132}
1133
1134static void intel_uncore_fw_domains_init(struct drm_device *dev)
1135{
1136 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1137
1138 if (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv->dev)->gen <= 5)
1139 return;
1140
1141 if (IS_GEN9(dev)) {
1142 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get = fw_domains_get;
1143 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put = fw_domains_put;
1144 fw_domain_init(dev_priv, FW_DOMAIN_ID_RENDER,
1145 FORCEWAKE_RENDER_GEN9,
1146 FORCEWAKE_ACK_RENDER_GEN9);
1147 fw_domain_init(dev_priv, FW_DOMAIN_ID_BLITTER,
1148 FORCEWAKE_BLITTER_GEN9,
1149 FORCEWAKE_ACK_BLITTER_GEN9);
1150 fw_domain_init(dev_priv, FW_DOMAIN_ID_MEDIA,
1151 FORCEWAKE_MEDIA_GEN9, FORCEWAKE_ACK_MEDIA_GEN9);
1152 } else if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev)) {
1153 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get = fw_domains_get;
1154 if (!IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev))
1155 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put =
1156 fw_domains_put_with_fifo;
1157 else
1158 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put = fw_domains_put;
1159 fw_domain_init(dev_priv, FW_DOMAIN_ID_RENDER,
1160 FORCEWAKE_VLV, FORCEWAKE_ACK_VLV);
1161 fw_domain_init(dev_priv, FW_DOMAIN_ID_MEDIA,
1162 FORCEWAKE_MEDIA_VLV, FORCEWAKE_ACK_MEDIA_VLV);
1163 } else if (IS_HASWELL(dev) || IS_BROADWELL(dev)) {
1164 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get =
1165 fw_domains_get_with_thread_status;
1166 if (IS_HASWELL(dev))
1167 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put =
1168 fw_domains_put_with_fifo;
1169 else
1170 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put = fw_domains_put;
1171 fw_domain_init(dev_priv, FW_DOMAIN_ID_RENDER,
1172 FORCEWAKE_MT, FORCEWAKE_ACK_HSW);
1173 } else if (IS_IVYBRIDGE(dev)) {
1174 u32 ecobus;
1175
1176 /* IVB configs may use multi-threaded forcewake */
1177
1178 /* A small trick here - if the bios hasn't configured
1179 * MT forcewake, and if the device is in RC6, then
1180 * force_wake_mt_get will not wake the device and the
1181 * ECOBUS read will return zero. Which will be
1182 * (correctly) interpreted by the test below as MT
1183 * forcewake being disabled.
1184 */
1185 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get =
1186 fw_domains_get_with_thread_status;
1187 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put =
1188 fw_domains_put_with_fifo;
1189
1190 /* We need to init first for ECOBUS access and then
1191 * determine later if we want to reinit, in case of MT access is
1192 * not working. In this stage we don't know which flavour this
1193 * ivb is, so it is better to reset also the gen6 fw registers
1194 * before the ecobus check.
1195 */
1196
1197 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE, 0);
1198 __raw_posting_read(dev_priv, ECOBUS);
1199
1200 fw_domain_init(dev_priv, FW_DOMAIN_ID_RENDER,
1201 FORCEWAKE_MT, FORCEWAKE_MT_ACK);
1202
1203 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1204 fw_domains_get_with_thread_status(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
1205 ecobus = __raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, ECOBUS);
1206 fw_domains_put_with_fifo(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
1207 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1208
1209 if (!(ecobus & FORCEWAKE_MT_ENABLE)) {
1210 DRM_INFO("No MT forcewake available on Ivybridge, this can result in issues\n");
1211 DRM_INFO("when using vblank-synced partial screen updates.\n");
1212 fw_domain_init(dev_priv, FW_DOMAIN_ID_RENDER,
1213 FORCEWAKE, FORCEWAKE_ACK);
1214 }
1215 } else if (IS_GEN6(dev)) {
1216 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_get =
1217 fw_domains_get_with_thread_status;
1218 dev_priv->uncore.funcs.force_wake_put =
1219 fw_domains_put_with_fifo;
1220 fw_domain_init(dev_priv, FW_DOMAIN_ID_RENDER,
1221 FORCEWAKE, FORCEWAKE_ACK);
1222 }
1223
1224 /* All future platforms are expected to require complex power gating */
1225 WARN_ON(dev_priv->uncore.fw_domains == 0);
1226}
1227
1228void intel_uncore_init(struct drm_device *dev)
1229{
1230 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1231
1232 i915_check_vgpu(dev);
1233
1234 intel_uncore_ellc_detect(dev);
1235 intel_uncore_fw_domains_init(dev);
1236 __intel_uncore_early_sanitize(dev, false);
1237
1238 switch (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen) {
1239 default:
1240 case 9:
1241 ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen9);
1242 ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen9);
1243 break;
1244 case 8:
1245 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev)) {
1246 ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS(chv);
1247 ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS(chv);
1248
1249 } else {
1250 ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen8);
1251 ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen6);
1252 }
1253 break;
1254 case 7:
1255 case 6:
1256 if (IS_HASWELL(dev)) {
1257 ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS(hsw);
1258 } else {
1259 ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen6);
1260 }
1261
1262 if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev)) {
1263 ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS(vlv);
1264 } else {
1265 ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen6);
1266 }
1267 break;
1268 case 5:
1269 ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen5);
1270 ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen5);
1271 break;
1272 case 4:
1273 case 3:
1274 case 2:
1275 ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen2);
1276 ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS(gen2);
1277 break;
1278 }
1279
1280 if (intel_vgpu_active(dev)) {
1281 ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS(vgpu);
1282 ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS(vgpu);
1283 }
1284
1285 i915_check_and_clear_faults(dev);
1286}
1287#undef ASSIGN_WRITE_MMIO_VFUNCS
1288#undef ASSIGN_READ_MMIO_VFUNCS
1289
1290void intel_uncore_fini(struct drm_device *dev)
1291{
1292#ifdef __NetBSD__
1293 struct drm_i915_private *const dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1294 unsigned i;
1295#endif
1296
1297 /* Paranoia: make sure we have disabled everything before we exit. */
1298 intel_uncore_sanitize(dev);
1299 intel_uncore_forcewake_reset(dev, false);
1300
1301#ifdef __NetBSD__
1302 for (i = 0; i < FW_DOMAIN_ID_COUNT; i++) {
1303 if (dev_priv->uncore.fw_domains & (1u << i))
1304 teardown_timer(&dev_priv->uncore.fw_domain[i].timer);
1305 }
1306#endif
1307}
1308
1309#define GEN_RANGE(l, h) GENMASK(h, l)
1310
1311static const struct register_whitelist {
1312 uint64_t offset;
1313 uint32_t size;
1314 /* supported gens, 0x10 for 4, 0x30 for 4 and 5, etc. */
1315 uint32_t gen_bitmask;
1316} whitelist[] = {
1317 { RING_TIMESTAMP(RENDER_RING_BASE), 8, GEN_RANGE(4, 9) },
1318};
1319
1320int i915_reg_read_ioctl(struct drm_device *dev,
1321 void *data, struct drm_file *file)
1322{
1323 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1324 struct drm_i915_reg_read *reg = data;
1325 struct register_whitelist const *entry = whitelist;
1326 unsigned size;
1327 u64 offset;
1328 int i, ret = 0;
1329
1330 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(whitelist); i++, entry++) {
1331 if (entry->offset == (reg->offset & -entry->size) &&
1332 (1 << INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen & entry->gen_bitmask))
1333 break;
1334 }
1335
1336 if (i == ARRAY_SIZE(whitelist))
1337 return -EINVAL;
1338
1339 /* We use the low bits to encode extra flags as the register should
1340 * be naturally aligned (and those that are not so aligned merely
1341 * limit the available flags for that register).
1342 */
1343 offset = entry->offset;
1344 size = entry->size;
1345 size |= reg->offset ^ offset;
1346
1347 intel_runtime_pm_get(dev_priv);
1348
1349 switch (size) {
1350 case 8 | 1:
1351 reg->val = I915_READ64_2x32(offset, offset+4);
1352 break;
1353 case 8:
1354 reg->val = I915_READ64(offset);
1355 break;
1356 case 4:
1357 reg->val = I915_READ(offset);
1358 break;
1359 case 2:
1360 reg->val = I915_READ16(offset);
1361 break;
1362 case 1:
1363 reg->val = I915_READ8(offset);
1364 break;
1365 default:
1366 ret = -EINVAL;
1367 goto out;
1368 }
1369
1370out:
1371 intel_runtime_pm_put(dev_priv);
1372 return ret;
1373}
1374
1375int i915_get_reset_stats_ioctl(struct drm_device *dev,
1376 void *data, struct drm_file *file)
1377{
1378 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1379 struct drm_i915_reset_stats *args = data;
1380 struct i915_ctx_hang_stats *hs;
1381 struct intel_context *ctx;
1382 int ret;
1383
1384 if (args->flags || args->pad)
1385 return -EINVAL;
1386
1387#ifdef __NetBSD__
1388 if (args->ctx_id == DEFAULT_CONTEXT_HANDLE && !DRM_SUSER())
1389 return -EPERM;
1390#else
1391 if (args->ctx_id == DEFAULT_CONTEXT_HANDLE && !capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
1392 return -EPERM;
1393#endif
1394
1395 ret = mutex_lock_interruptible(&dev->struct_mutex);
1396 if (ret)
1397 return ret;
1398
1399 ctx = i915_gem_context_get(file->driver_priv, args->ctx_id);
1400 if (IS_ERR(ctx)) {
1401 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1402 return PTR_ERR(ctx);
1403 }
1404 hs = &ctx->hang_stats;
1405
1406#ifdef __NetBSD__
1407 if (DRM_SUSER())
1408#else
1409 if (capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
1410#endif
1411 args->reset_count = i915_reset_count(&dev_priv->gpu_error);
1412 else
1413 args->reset_count = 0;
1414
1415 args->batch_active = hs->batch_active;
1416 args->batch_pending = hs->batch_pending;
1417
1418 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1419
1420 return 0;
1421}
1422
1423static int i915_reset_complete(struct drm_device *dev)
1424{
1425 u8 gdrst;
1426 pci_read_config_byte(dev->pdev, I915_GDRST, &gdrst);
1427 return (gdrst & GRDOM_RESET_STATUS) == 0;
1428}
1429
1430static int i915_do_reset(struct drm_device *dev)
1431{
1432 /* assert reset for at least 20 usec */
1433 pci_write_config_byte(dev->pdev, I915_GDRST, GRDOM_RESET_ENABLE);
1434 udelay(20);
1435 pci_write_config_byte(dev->pdev, I915_GDRST, 0);
1436
1437 return wait_for(i915_reset_complete(dev), 500);
1438}
1439
1440static int g4x_reset_complete(struct drm_device *dev)
1441{
1442 u8 gdrst;
1443 pci_read_config_byte(dev->pdev, I915_GDRST, &gdrst);
1444 return (gdrst & GRDOM_RESET_ENABLE) == 0;
1445}
1446
1447static int g33_do_reset(struct drm_device *dev)
1448{
1449 pci_write_config_byte(dev->pdev, I915_GDRST, GRDOM_RESET_ENABLE);
1450 return wait_for(g4x_reset_complete(dev), 500);
1451}
1452
1453static int g4x_do_reset(struct drm_device *dev)
1454{
1455 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1456 int ret;
1457
1458 pci_write_config_byte(dev->pdev, I915_GDRST,
1459 GRDOM_RENDER | GRDOM_RESET_ENABLE);
1460 ret = wait_for(g4x_reset_complete(dev), 500);
1461 if (ret)
1462 return ret;
1463
1464 /* WaVcpClkGateDisableForMediaReset:ctg,elk */
1465 I915_WRITE(VDECCLK_GATE_D, I915_READ(VDECCLK_GATE_D) | VCP_UNIT_CLOCK_GATE_DISABLE);
1466 POSTING_READ(VDECCLK_GATE_D);
1467
1468 pci_write_config_byte(dev->pdev, I915_GDRST,
1469 GRDOM_MEDIA | GRDOM_RESET_ENABLE);
1470 ret = wait_for(g4x_reset_complete(dev), 500);
1471 if (ret)
1472 return ret;
1473
1474 /* WaVcpClkGateDisableForMediaReset:ctg,elk */
1475 I915_WRITE(VDECCLK_GATE_D, I915_READ(VDECCLK_GATE_D) & ~VCP_UNIT_CLOCK_GATE_DISABLE);
1476 POSTING_READ(VDECCLK_GATE_D);
1477
1478 pci_write_config_byte(dev->pdev, I915_GDRST, 0);
1479
1480 return 0;
1481}
1482
1483static int ironlake_do_reset(struct drm_device *dev)
1484{
1485 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1486 int ret;
1487
1488 I915_WRITE(ILK_GDSR,
1489 ILK_GRDOM_RENDER | ILK_GRDOM_RESET_ENABLE);
1490 ret = wait_for((I915_READ(ILK_GDSR) &
1491 ILK_GRDOM_RESET_ENABLE) == 0, 500);
1492 if (ret)
1493 return ret;
1494
1495 I915_WRITE(ILK_GDSR,
1496 ILK_GRDOM_MEDIA | ILK_GRDOM_RESET_ENABLE);
1497 ret = wait_for((I915_READ(ILK_GDSR) &
1498 ILK_GRDOM_RESET_ENABLE) == 0, 500);
1499 if (ret)
1500 return ret;
1501
1502 I915_WRITE(ILK_GDSR, 0);
1503
1504 return 0;
1505}
1506
1507static int gen6_do_reset(struct drm_device *dev)
1508{
1509 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1510 int ret;
1511
1512 /* Reset the chip */
1513
1514 /* GEN6_GDRST is not in the gt power well, no need to check
1515 * for fifo space for the write or forcewake the chip for
1516 * the read
1517 */
1518 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, GEN6_GDRST, GEN6_GRDOM_FULL);
1519
1520 /* Spin waiting for the device to ack the reset request */
1521 ret = wait_for((__raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, GEN6_GDRST) & GEN6_GRDOM_FULL) == 0, 500);
1522
1523 intel_uncore_forcewake_reset(dev, true);
1524
1525 return ret;
1526}
1527
1528static int wait_for_register(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
1529 const u32 reg,
1530 const u32 mask,
1531 const u32 value,
1532 const unsigned long timeout_ms)
1533{
1534 return wait_for((I915_READ(reg) & mask) == value, timeout_ms);
1535}
1536
1537static int gen8_do_reset(struct drm_device *dev)
1538{
1539 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1540 struct intel_engine_cs *engine;
1541 int i;
1542
1543 for_each_ring(engine, dev_priv, i) {
1544 I915_WRITE(RING_RESET_CTL(engine->mmio_base),
1545 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(RESET_CTL_REQUEST_RESET));
1546
1547 if (wait_for_register(dev_priv,
1548 RING_RESET_CTL(engine->mmio_base),
1549 RESET_CTL_READY_TO_RESET,
1550 RESET_CTL_READY_TO_RESET,
1551 700)) {
1552 DRM_ERROR("%s: reset request timeout\n", engine->name);
1553 goto not_ready;
1554 }
1555 }
1556
1557 return gen6_do_reset(dev);
1558
1559not_ready:
1560 for_each_ring(engine, dev_priv, i)
1561 I915_WRITE(RING_RESET_CTL(engine->mmio_base),
1562 _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(RESET_CTL_REQUEST_RESET));
1563
1564 return -EIO;
1565}
1566
1567static int (*intel_get_gpu_reset(struct drm_device *dev))(struct drm_device *)
1568{
1569 if (!i915.reset)
1570 return NULL;
1571
1572 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8)
1573 return gen8_do_reset;
1574 else if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 6)
1575 return gen6_do_reset;
1576 else if (IS_GEN5(dev))
1577 return ironlake_do_reset;
1578 else if (IS_G4X(dev))
1579 return g4x_do_reset;
1580 else if (IS_G33(dev))
1581 return g33_do_reset;
1582 else if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 3)
1583 return i915_do_reset;
1584 else
1585 return NULL;
1586}
1587
1588int intel_gpu_reset(struct drm_device *dev)
1589{
1590 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(dev);
1591 int (*reset)(struct drm_device *);
1592 int ret;
1593
1594 reset = intel_get_gpu_reset(dev);
1595 if (reset == NULL)
1596 return -ENODEV;
1597
1598 /* If the power well sleeps during the reset, the reset
1599 * request may be dropped and never completes (causing -EIO).
1600 */
1601 intel_uncore_forcewake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
1602 ret = reset(dev);
1603 intel_uncore_forcewake_put(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
1604
1605 return ret;
1606}
1607
1608bool intel_has_gpu_reset(struct drm_device *dev)
1609{
1610 return intel_get_gpu_reset(dev) != NULL;
1611}
1612
1613void intel_uncore_check_errors(struct drm_device *dev)
1614{
1615 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1616
1617 if (HAS_FPGA_DBG_UNCLAIMED(dev) &&
1618 (__raw_i915_read32(dev_priv, FPGA_DBG) & FPGA_DBG_RM_NOCLAIM)) {
1619 DRM_ERROR("Unclaimed register before interrupt\n");
1620 __raw_i915_write32(dev_priv, FPGA_DBG, FPGA_DBG_RM_NOCLAIM);
1621 }
1622}
